text: do you love eggplant parmesean because I

melted cheese it gets brown on top but
eggplants aren't a winter vegetable so
in this recipe I substitute cauliflower
I get something that's cozy that's warm
and in season the key element of a good
pan of parm isn't just using Parmesan
cheese it's also frying whatever goes in
there you want that crunchy fried
coating to contrast with all that melty
creamy cheese on top and by the way
fried cauliflower is a delicious thing
you should do it anyway even if you're
not making parm just fry some

gonna do it the extra crunchy way I'm

you want to season all of these things
really aggressively that way some of the
salt and pepper is actually gonna reach

seasoned at the end and a lot of pepper
what the flour does is it absorbs any
moisture on the surface of whatever
you're frying and then the egg could
stick really well to the flour it's
almost like glue and then you do the
breadcrumbs and then the breadcrumbs
stick really well to the eggs so you're
basically getting as much crunch as
possible into a small little space you
don't need to deep-fry these you could

inch of oil obviously don't use the
super good stuff you can use the

for your pan to get hot
you don't want to crowd the pan because
if you crowd the pan they're all gonna
just kind of steam instead of getting

gets soaked up nice another advantage to
cauliflower over eggplant is that
eggplant it's like a sponge and it just
soaks up all of the oil in the pan
not so much cauliflower so you get less
oil per bite now you just want to layer

try not to splatter your shirt we have

you'll taste a difference and then you

and now you bacon a thing of beauty
